definition: honorific: I've long looked forward to meeting you./It's an honor to meet you at last.
(long) time/(long) duration of time
surname Yang
to face upward/to look up/to admire/to rely on
I have been looking forward to meeting you for a long time (idiom)

sentences.english: I have heard of your wife for a long time. Today, I finally have the honor of meeting her.
sentences.chinese: 我可是久仰尊夫人的芳名，今天才有幸见到。

sentences.english: Nice to meet you . I've heard a lot about you.
sentences.chinese: 很高兴认识您，久仰大名。

sentences.english: Nice to meet you . I’ve heard a lot about you.
sentences.chinese: 很高兴认识你，久仰大名。

sentences.english: I have just met an author I have always admired.
sentences.chinese: 我遇到一位我久仰的作家。

sentences.english: "Maybe the killer ever hears a lot about you, he decided to treasure his live well. " Bob taunted.
sentences.chinese: 大概是凶手久仰过妳大名，他决定要好好爱惜生命了。

sentences.english: I am very happy to meet two scholars I admire in New York, 18 Oct 2006.
sentences.chinese: 很高兴在纽约的演讲中见到两位久仰的学者。

sentences.english: I've heard a lot about you from Mr. Scott.
sentences.chinese: 我从史考特先生处久仰大名。

sentences.english: I am delighted to meet you at last!
sentences.chinese: 久仰，很高兴终于与你见面了。

definition: I have been looking forward to meeting you for a long time (idiom)
your name has been known to me for a long time (polite)
nice to meet you
knowing sb by their reputation can't compare to meeting them in person (idiom)
pinyin: wen2 ming2 bu4 ru2 jian4 mian4

definition: lit. I dare not (accept the honor); fig. I don't deserve your praise/you flatter me
to return a politeness/to present a gift in return
we are honored by your presence
lit. I'm ashamed and dare not (accept the honor); fig. I do not deserve your praise./You flatter me too much.
lit. like thunder piercing the ear/a well-known reputation (idiom)
(literary) I trust you have been well since we last met
to speak seriously/to exaggerate
lit. I've admired you for a long time (honorific)./I've been looking forward to meeting you./It's an honor to meet you at last.
(polite) excuse me for not going out to meet you
you let me win (said politely after winning a game)
lit. your honored carriage/your highness/honored Sir (also sarcastic)/you
to overpraise/to flatter
